me.utk.util.misc

Class ThreadUtil.ThreadLocker

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.utk.util.misc.ThreadUtil.ThreadLocker
  • Enclosing class:
    ThreadUtil

    public static class ThreadUtil.ThreadLocker
extends Object
    A dual-purpose utility class focused on providing thread-locking functionality.

    The ThreadLocker can perform two functions, depending on its initialization and internal state during runtime:

    • When initialized appropriately and up until being deactivated by a call to the deactivate method, a ThreadLocker instance can pause the current thread for the specified time interval using Object.wait() and Object.notify().
    • Regardless of initialization or deactivation status, a ThreadLocker instance can also be used independently in client applications as an internal thread-locking object by calling the wait and notify methods directly.
    See Also:
    Object.wait(), Object.notify(), Object.notifyAll()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ThreadLocker()
      Creates a ThreadLocker in its deactivated state.
      ThreadLocker(boolean canThreadWait)
      Creates a ThreadLocker in an activated or deactivated state depending on the given argument.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Switches this ThreadLocker instance to a deactivated state.
      void waitFor(long time, TimeUnit units)
      Pauses the current thread for the specified length of time if and only if this ThreadLocker instance is in an activated state.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadLocker

        public ThreadLocker()
        Creates a ThreadLocker in its deactivated state.

      • ThreadLocker

        public ThreadLocker(boolean canThreadWait)
        Creates a ThreadLocker in an activated or deactivated state depending on the given argument.
        Parameters:
        canThreadWait - If true, this object is initialized in an activated state; otherwise, if false, the object is initialized in a deactivated state.

    • Method Detail

      • waitFor

        public void waitFor(long time,
                    TimeUnit units)
             throws InterruptedException
        Pauses the current thread for the specified length of time if and only if this ThreadLocker instance is in an activated state.

        This method pauses the current thread using this ThreadLocker instance's Object.wait() method and unpauses the thread by a subsequent call to Object.notify().

        Parameters:
        time - The number of time units to pause for
        units - The units for the pause time
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this ThreadLocker instance is currently in a deactivated state, whether from initialization or as a result of a call to the deactivate method.
        InterruptedException - If using the wait method instead would throw this exception
        See Also:
        Object.wait(), Object.notify(), Object.notifyAll()

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Switches this ThreadLocker instance to a deactivated state.

        When deactivated, this ThreadLocker instance can no longer use the waitFor method, or else it will throw an exception. However, this object can still be used to block threads direcly using Object.wait() and Object.notify().

        See Also:
        Object.wait(), Object.notify(), Object.notifyAll()
